content.question: Two identical parallel plates of area <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> have charges of equal magnitude <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> but opposite signs evenly distributed through its area. A Gaussian surface is drawn that surrounds only the negative plate. Which of the following expressions is correct for the electric flux through the Gaussian surface?

choices.label: <math alttext="the negative fraction Q over epsilon sub 0, end sub, A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>ε</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mi>A</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the positive fraction Q over epsilon sub 0, end sub, A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>ε</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mi>A</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the negative fraction Q over epsilon sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>ε</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the positive fraction Q over epsilon sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>ε</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the negative fraction Q over epsilon sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>ε</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
